t: God, a Helper against the Treacherous.
For the choir director; upon an eight-stringed lyre. A Psalm of David.
Help,*pn Lord,*s for the godly man ceases to be, For*ln the faithful disappear from among the sons of men.
They*ln speak falsehood to one another; With*ln flattering lips and with a double heart they speak.
May*ln the Lord*s cut off all flattering lips, The*ln tongue that speaks great things;
Who*ln have said, “With our tongue we will prevail; Our*ln lips are our own; who is lord over us?”
“Because*ln of the devastation of the afflicted, because of the groaning of the needy, Now*ln I will arise,” says the Lord;*s “I will set him in the safety for which he longs.”
The*ln words of the Lord*s are pure words; As*ln silver tried in a furnace on the earth, refined seven times.
You,*ln O Lord,*s will keep them; You*ln will preserve him from this generation forever.
The*ln wicked strut about on every side When*ln vileness is exalted among the sons of men.
